findings.title: Transfer operations may silently fail due to the lack of contract existence checks
findings.description: The pool fails to check that a contract exists before performing transfers. As a result, the pool may assume that failed transactions involving destroyed tokens or tokens that have not yet been deployed were successful.

findings.title: Project dependencies contain vulnerabilities
findings.description: The project's dependencies (`underscore`, `lodash`, and `follow-redirects`) were updated, but additional vulnerable dependencies remain in the codebase with `node-fetch`.

findings.title: Anyone could steal pool tokens' earned interest
findings.description: An attacker can call a function to calculate and increase their token balance within the depositCallback function, reducing the user's token payment obligation.

findings.title: Solidity compiler optimizations can be problematic
findings.description: High-severity security issues due to optimization bugs have occurred in the past and may still exist or emerge in the future.

findings.title: Lack of zero-value checks on functions
findings.description: Certain setter functions fail to validate incoming arguments, so callers can accidentally set important state variables to the zero address.
findings.contract: Multiple contracts (PrimitiveEngine, PositionDescriptor, MarginManager, SwapManager, CashManager)
findings.function: deposit, withdraw, allocate, swap, constructor, unwrap, sweepToken

findings.title: Non-Inverse Percentage Functions
findings.description: The uint256.percentage() and int256.percentage() functions are not inverses of each other due to rounding down toward zero, resulting in potential precision loss.

findings.title: Users can allocate tokens to a pool at the moment the pool reaches maturity
findings.description: The function allows users to allocate tokens to a pool when it reaches maturity, which may lead to unintended behavior or security risks.

findings.title: Possible front-running vulnerability during BUFFER time
findings.description: The `PrimitiveEngine.swap` function permits swap transactions until 120 seconds after maturity, which could enable miners to front-run swap transactions and engage in malicious behavior.

findings.title: Inconsistency in allocate and remove functions
findings.description: The allocate and remove functions have inconsistent behavior resulting in a difference of 1,920,041,647,503 in allocated and removed amounts.

findings.title: Areas of the codebase that are inconsistent with the documentation
findings.description: Inconsistencies between the codebase and documentation were found.

findings.title: Allocate and remove are not exact inverses of each other
findings.description: The allocate and remove functions do not behave as exact inverses, resulting in a difference of 1,920,041,647,503 in allocated and removed amounts.

findings.title: Non-Inverse scaleToX64() and scalefromX64() Functions
findings.description: The functions scaleToX64() and scalefromX64() are not inverses of each other due to rounding downward toward zero when using ABDKMath64x64.divu() and ABDKMath64x64.mulu(), resulting in loss of precision when converting between uint256 and signed 64x64 fixed point numbers

findings.title: getCDF always returns output in the range of (0, 1)
findings.description: The getCDF function always returns a value within the range of (0, 1).

findings.title: Lack of data validation on withdrawal operations
findings.description: The `withdraw` function allows users to specify the recipient to send funds to. Due to a lack of data validation, the address of the engine could be set as the recipient. As a result, the tokens will be transferred directly to the engine itself.
